Headings: When iPhone app connects strange messages appear
Base_Reviews: Initially connecting an iPhone using the Screen Mirroring companion App to the Fire Stick Screen Mirroring App the connection works but after a couple of minutes a message appears on the TV that there is an error described as unauthorized use. You can't get rid of that message even when you exit the Fire Stick App. The only way to get rid of the message is to actually reboot the Fire Stick. Although there is nu charge for the Screen Mirroring Fire Stick App I had to pay for the companion iPhone version which turned out to be two different applications from that company. So I have invested money in something that DOES NOT WORK. The company's answer was I had to wait for a new update in their application. They should have refunded my money for the iPhone apps.

I noticed that the app has a privacy policy update, but it’s not very clear about how my data will be used. Also, I couldn’t find any details about whether the app complies with GDPR or other international data protection laws. I usually like to know how my personal information is handled, especially when apps require access to my contacts and location. It would be helpful if the developers provided more transparency on this

Headings: Not simple but made it work
Base_Reviews: Thanks to a previous review I was able to make it work on a Kindle Fire HD. In the Print Preview screen go to the Protocol setting at the bottom of the left menu bar. Change LPD to IPP.

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

When I opened the app it came up with a message, something about how I liked the app.  Since I hadn't looked at it yet I couldn't say.  After I looked at the app and can see it has some glitches I could no longer get the "what did I think of the app".  When I tried to access a recipe that was offered from the recipe picture pages a different recipe would come up - not the one I asked to see.  After doing this numerous times with various recipes pictured I have determined that this definitely "Needs some work".  Maybe it can stay on my apps, but I don't know if I'll bother using it it I can't access a particular recipe.  And, thanks for putting the How do you like this app feature upon the first opening of the app.  How did I know that it doesn't exactly work as advertised.  Not impressed.  Also, don't like the new Foodnetwork style.  Printing is WAY too big.  Like I don't need to use 1/4 page of a piece of paper for the title of the recipe only.  That, with all the "competition cooking" shows, and I'm about to write Foodnetwork off of my radar.

Headings: Several things to make me hate Fubo - FOREVER
Base_Reviews: Right off the bat, the highest resolution this service offered for PC was 720p. That was enough for me to cancel, which I did immediately. Then I though maybe the resolution might be higher on my smart TV. Guess what? I never found out. Because when you cancel your subscription, Fubo locks you out immediately. So much for a free trial. You only get a free week if they get to keep your subscription intact. BOGUS MAN! Nobody does that. I mean like literally NOBODY else does that. I wanted to try this service without being stuck paying the extremely high subscription. I wanted to TRY the service. Fubo has no interest in me trying it. They want me to pay. So what if the first week is free - they want the big money. So they can suck it. And suck it hard. I will never try Fubo ever again. My 2 minute experience was woeful enough, but it was long enough to see how they run their business. Jackass mofos. 720p laughin my buttocks off.The stupid thing is, I am trying really hard to find a solution to cutting the cable company cord. I've been trying various things and keep coming up with the stiff end of these provider's business practices. Add Fubo to that list. I'm probably gonna have to end up with YouTube TV which literally makes me wanna cry.  I am willing to pay a monthly fee, but I literally HATE TV SHOWS! All I want is access to sports, without having 14 different subscriptions. Oh well. Sports bar. Friend's house. Pirate site hahahahahaha. Surely in a few more years there will be valid solutions for sports fans. Fubo will certainly never get my money.

Kindle Fire 8.9" HD. Installed Skype for tablet from the Kindle App Store. Already had a Skype account on my computer so account setup was not an issue. Audio volume is buggered. The start up sound is fine. The ring sound is low and call volume is very low. This appears to be a software problem in Skype. They need to fix this problem.THe video quality is very good with a good wi-fi connection. The microphone works well and does not appear to pick up too much surrounding noise. The person I was talking to said that the volume was fine on their end.When Skype corrects the volume problem, this will be a 5 star application. Until then 3 stars at most.A delete and second install seems to have cured the volume problem and Skype now works well.

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

So got my kindle for Christmas and was happy that it came with this app cause I finally had a mobile Skype. Didn't enjoy the fact that if I had my keyboard up in the IMs that I couldn't see if someone was messaging me, from what my sister says she has the same problem on her phone. I learned to deal with it, simply close the keyboard randomly to check if that orange "1" is flashing. Most annoying was that even if I signed out Skype would still display me as online causing me to uninstall the app whenever I didn't want to appear online.Fast forward to today and I download Skype to find it has a new update,and a crappy one at that. Now it has "tablet mode" and "smart phone mode" which are supposed to be "optimized" for that type of device. Which is an outright lite given that I'm on a kindle and using the smartphone mode because it's the only one that flips with the screen. Why they removed the screen matching the position of the tablet but kept it for the phone is beyond me.While a complete and utter bell/whistle they even removed the profile picture that appears next to the person's name while in chat.

Headings: If you thought cable was bad, wait til you try fubo!
Base_Reviews: Oh where to start.....World Cup France v Morocco, oops, Fubo not available.  What???  Customer service, after an hour wait, suggested I watch on Fox streaming for free.  Fox only allows 60 minutes before you need to use your tv subscriber info, which didn't work with fubo.  ha ha...TV app is worthless.  Buffering with 1000mbps and new tv?  Will not rewind or fast forward on recorded shows.  You can watch on your big screen if you stream from iPhone to tv.  It isn't perfect though.Nevertheless, I imagine the slugs who took the company public are laughing all the way to the bank.I suggest shorting the stock (which would have been a great idea earlier in the year as the stock price is hovering around $2 and some change), you may be able to make back some of your subscription fees!Lastly, I do feel sorry for the customer service reps.  I am sure they get an earful daily.  I have had some nice ones in all fairness.All the best,FubismalPS: can't wait to I see my credit card continue to get charged after I cancel, which I have yet to experience, but the majority of reviews seem to allude to Fubo's inability to cancel accounts. Should be more fun!

Headings: I wish I could give it less than one star.
Base_Reviews: I bought two Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32G tablets for my husband and I for Christmas presents.  He is a marine, I thought that for his deployment this would be great for entertainment and communication.  This app has worked correctly once.  Just one single time.  The speakers stopped putting out what he was saying, the screen freezes, calls are "busy" over and over again (even though we confirmed the other person is not making a call).  I'll be deleting this App and might try to re-download, but I don't have much faith.This is separate from the Skype review - but I'm incredibly disappointed with my Kindle over all.  It seems that most things don't work - except for things eligible for purchase off of Amazon.  I am an avid PC/Android user - and I hate to say it - but I wish I had just bought an IPAD.

Absolutely the most useless program on the planet. I plan to sell my kindle back to amazon as soon as I get home for the measily 56 bucks they are offering after my 7 months of ownership and I am buying a IPAD thats right I said it. Headings: Did not properly work with my Brother DCP7065DN printer
Base_Reviews: Under "MayDay" guidance, we tried this app today, but could not get it to print files to my Brother Printer DCP7065DN Monochrome Laser Multi-Function Printer/Scanner/Copier. There was no DCP7065 driver, so the MayDay technician, knowing that higher number drivers are supposed to be backward compatible, tried the next higher driver, but no luck. That driver printed a boatload of blank pages, and trying to use the Brother driver did not work, and the iPrint app was not available from Chrome for some weird reason.The tech helped me with a workaround. Save the file as a PDF, then print the PDF. The iPrint driver does work woth the DCP7065. Hallelujah.

Headings: More headache searching thru code for my docs!
Base_Reviews: I hate not being able to print my downloaded documents directly from my Kindle. All I saw on Print Hammermill was lines and lines of numbers and letters, and had to write down the numbers from my documents, because I couldn't remember all that. Then go and searched through all that code for the correct document number. Before, I just went to My Documents on Kindle, selected the one I wanted, selected Print, and boom - done. What was wrong with keeping that, PLUS the app. if that's what someone wanted? Everything gets more and more complicated and more difficult to use. Who sits around all day and thinks of ways to make things more complicated? As an added insult to the public, there are never any instructions available anymore. Not everyone is a techie. Companies need to hire techs who can SIMPLIFY things!

Headings: The Hammermill app is working for me beautifully.
Base_Reviews: I downloaded this app in July of 2014 and could never get it to work with my Canon MP810 and my Kindle, via Bluetooth. After replacing my 8-year-old Canon with a Canon Maxify 2020 this week, I thought I'd try again. I had to use Hammermill's generic drivers, but the app found my new Canon immediately and I can now print from my 2nd Gen Kindle Fire. If you have a 2nd Gen Kindle Fire and a Canon printer, don't bother with the Canon Print Plug-in, which is only compatible with 3rd Gen and later. The Hammermill app is working for me beautifully.

Headings: Works with minimal muss and fuss
Base_Reviews: Works well with Google Cloud Print and with little effort I could get stuff printed from my device to both a Brother laser printer (not wifi, but connected as the printer to an ASUS RT-N16 router) and an absolutely ancient Canon S600 inkjet.  When rendering Excel charts via Google Sheets, while the print was serviceable, it wasn't quite as spiffy as one printed directly via Excel on the desktop.  Also printed emails nicely formatted.  Is a very handy way to get to the Cloud Print facility, with minimal advertising, and that solely for Hammermill papers, as one might expect.

Since I foolishly dropped and broke my Fire 7 gen 7, I needed a printing app for my new Fire 7 gen 9 (and my still very reliable HP wireless printer) since the Mopria Services app that is supposedly lurking somewhere in the Fire operating system of this new generation device absolutely refuses to find my HP printer and Amazon "no longer supports" the excellent, free and previous "go to" HP e print or even the also once offered and also free HP plug in. Out of frustration, I downloaded the initially "free"  Hammer app from the Amazon app store.Guess what! Hammer easily found my HP printer and I was much relieved! But then, Hammer required an additional download to proceed...which I did...and then, Hammer refused to print until I upgraded to a paid premium version.Oh, oh...the old bait and switch.Feeling adequately Hammered by Hammer and now definitely concerned about the trustworthiness of this provider, I uninstalled the offending app and moved on. Unfortunately, I still have not found an honest solution to connecting with my from this new tablet...but will.Not sure what Amazon has against HP printers...but their lack of proactive support as they transition generational is really starting to annoy me.

I tried several apps to enable printing with a Kindle Fire.  This is the only one that worked.  I like that it allows for Windows-shared printers, if you don't have a network-enabled printer or don't want to use Google Cloud print.  Through the main application, you can print emails, web pages, contacts, etc.  And through apps that enable "Send To", you can print directly from them as well.  The lack of a universal print capability is a bit of a limitation in the Kindle/Android OS itself.  But this app does the best that can be expected with those limitations.

Every time I try to download the rendering library it gives me an error and says to try again later. The only things I can't print out are Excel, PDF and Word documents. So if I have an Excel file open that I need to print for example when I click to print the file the app will tell me I need to download the rendering library to print the file so I click to download and that is when I am getting the error. Other than that I love this app. It works so fluid it feels like a native Blackberry app. I would definitely recommend this app.

Base_Reviews: This app asks you to pay for it every month just so you can open files with specific letters forming its file extension.

Sure it has a share button, but I'm a book editor, and I work for a publisher. I also freelance. I need to get both my publisher and my clients CLEAN, easy to open document attachments. So, I tapped the *send as attachment* button and ZOOOM! Away went a white screen that said, well, who knows what because it just whipped up off the top of my screen.So I thought, okay...I'll just send them a link.I thought I'd send it to myself first to see how easy this would be for my clients to use.So, I tap the appropriate button to send it to myself and get to preview before it sends. I figured I would click the link rather than waiting, and do you know what happens instead of sending a link to my document to my boss and my client?They are taken to THIS PAGE TO DOWNLOAD THE APP!!!This ANGERS ME TO NO END! I'm trying to use this as a PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS TOOL & THE COMPANY IS USING ME TO PASS THE WORD ABOUT THEIR PRODUCT?And the kicker is...the people I'm sending the document to use LAPTOPS or DESKTOPS and have no use for this!I didn't see my document attached, or a link to it, in the email, either. The ONLY THING there was a link to the landing page to download this app!I DID have some nice things to say about it - like, it's the only APP I found that lets me track changed (which my industry uses constantly), but what good is it if I can't get the doc back to my boss or client after it's completed? I don't get paid. In fact, I could get FIRED! And LOSE clients for sending them SPAM.THANKS A LOT MOBI!

Headings: BOY DO I WISH I HAD READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING THIS SOFTWARE
Base_Reviews: CAPITALIZATION in this review is NOT screaming ... just highlighting ...My initial "review to myself" was positive, when I tested a plain, short "Word" style document. It seemed to work just fine, and NOBODY releases software that doesn't work do they? snort!!! So I bought the program, and BOY! am I SORRY! that I did so, because I can now no longer get a refund as I have struggled SO long and SO hard, trying to make this piece of software do the simplest tasks.There is SO much of this app that either just plain does not work, or has VERY limited functionality, or does not work quite right, that I CANNOT in good conscience recommend this app to ANYONE for ANY reason.I have written to Support twice, and beyond the "We have received your request..." email notice, I have received NO response whatsoever to my request for assistance or clarification.The so called HELP system is more a list of what the menu options are than they are instructions on how to use this app. As a help system, it is WOEFULLY, and PITIFULLY inadequate. So mix the fact that parts of it, despite being available to the user, just do not work, the lack of reliable support and the lack of a comprehensive help system, and you get a miserable, FAILED attempt at a piece of software that should not have gone to market for a SIGNIFICANT additional period of time for development.And when I bought this, my ONLY option was a subscription so that I have to pay for it again, and AGAIN, EVERY year. What the heck happened to just being able to BUY a piece of software?These people need a couple of million bucks of investment money so that they can do some more development on this software so that it WORKS, and works COMPLETELY before they start selling it. As it stands, it needs a LOT more development. While SOME small parts of it DO work, it is NOT a replacement for microsoft office. There is just too much of it that does not work to warrant buying this app.I just CANNOT imagine a greater waste of money. This is probably THE worst purhase that I have EVER made online.

Stupid Annoying marketing). I used it a few times a day to see if it was what I wanted, because I do not like the AMAZON WPS product included in my FIRE HDX 7 Tablet at all. After about a week or so, Developer offered the Full-Pro version, for half price, so I purchased it.The only thing that I haven't been able to find is How To Send and Store all my files  to Amazon Prime Cloud, which I desire, because the HDX that I have only allows internal total user storage up to about 11.5GB. Maybe the feature is in the APP somewhere and I just haven't found it yet... Thus, 5 Star instead of a 4 star rating given.(Come On Amazon, When are  you going to update your rating system to allow Half Stars? Very,Very few man-made creations are 'Perfect' and deserving of a 5 Star!)

Headings: I wish I could give it less than one star.
Base_Reviews: I bought two Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32G tablets for my husband and I for Christmas presents.  He is a marine, I thought that for his deployment this would be great for entertainment and communication.  This app has worked correctly once.  Just one single time.  The speakers stopped putting out what he was saying, the screen freezes, calls are "busy" over and over again (even though we confirmed the other person is not making a call).  I'll be deleting this App and might try to re-download, but I don't have much faith.This is separate from the Skype review - but I'm incredibly disappointed with my Kindle over all.  It seems that most things don't work - except for things eligible for purchase off of Amazon.  I am an avid PC/Android user - and I hate to say it - but I wish I had just bought an IPAD.
I can see my friends and its like the normal Skype. I would recommend this thisapp than other Skype s.

First app used on the brand new Kindle Fire HD. Connected without a problem, but the picture quality was very poor, the voice transmission was spotty at best and the call couldn't stay connected. Was it our Wifi? Well, we disconnected the Skype call and dialed up via Facetime and had no problems at all. I'd say it was the Skype.

Headings: Protect yourself, Skype sure will not....
Base_Reviews: Do not expect Skype to protect you if the app does not work properly. Take care to pay for Skype services with an active credit card that handles disputes professionally. DO NOT use PayPal or bank account debits.Last March, I downloaded an app release by Skype for my Windows Phone. It did not work. Skype initially denied the existence of such an app. Finally, it acknowledged that it did not work properly.PayPal said my payment covered a service and not refundable. Skype ignored repeated request using email (no phone for a telephony provider?)Just today, pursuing use for my Kindle Fire, I found that my initial deposit was forfeit for inactivity. I used chat to request reinstatement. The representative seemed unable to extract information despite a "Dick & Jane" narrative, asking off-base questions and even, well into the conversation, requesting my screen name -- provided on the transcript. It became apparent that, if not illiterate, the representative was trained to deflect callers and outlast any caller's attempt at redress.

Kindle Fire 8.9" HD. Installed Skype for tablet from the Kindle App Store. Already had a Skype account on my computer so account setup was not an issue. Audio volume is buggered. The start up sound is fine. The ring sound is low and call volume is very low. This appears to be a software problem in Skype. They need to fix this problem.THe video quality is very good with a good wi-fi connection. The microphone works well and does not appear to pick up too much surrounding noise. The person I was talking to said that the volume was fine on their end.When Skype corrects the volume problem, this will be a 5 star application. Until then 3 stars at most.A delete and second install seems to have cured the volume problem and Skype now works well.

Headings: No group video chat with Kindle Fire HD and Skype...
Base_Reviews: I am giving this app 1 measly star because I can't give it 0 stars. I have been reading online and it appears Amazon/Skype has removed the group video chat capability of Skype with Kindle. I recently signed up for Skype Premium so I could group chat with my sons who live in different states. They both have Kindle Fire HD's. What a waste of $10?! At least I didn't pay for the whole year up front, I guess. Many of the reviews about Skype I have read were posted by folds who signed up for the entire year! After about 30 minutes of trying and having various issues, we gave up and I started doing some researching. We also had various other issues with Skype when trying to video chat one-on-one. Everything from the video freezing, dropping calls, slow video, and the app crashing. I will not be renewing my Skype membership unless this issue is fixed ASAP.

So got my kindle for Christmas and was happy that it came with this app cause I finally had a mobile Skype. Didn't enjoy the fact that if I had my keyboard up in the IMs that I couldn't see if someone was messaging me, from what my sister says she has the same problem on her phone. I learned to deal with it, simply close the keyboard randomly to check if that orange "1" is flashing. Most annoying was that even if I signed out Skype would still display me as online causing me to uninstall the app whenever I didn't want to appear online.Fast forward to today and I download Skype to find it has a new update,and a crappy one at that. Now it has "tablet mode" and "smart phone mode" which are supposed to be "optimized" for that type of device. Which is an outright lite given that I'm on a kindle and using the smartphone mode because it's the only one that flips with the screen. Why they removed the screen matching the position of the tablet but kept it for the phone is beyond me.While a complete and utter bell/whistle they even removed the profile picture that appears next to the person's name while in chat.
Amazing! K

I got a kindle to take travelling with me, partly to use Skype to keep in touch with home. All worked brilliantly till an automatic up date, supposedly making Skype better for the tablet, downloaded it's self. I've paid to have a number on Skype and do use credit to make some calls and send texts, but I've found that being a paying customer means nothing to Skype, I am evidently worthless to them.  It was near impossible to contact anyone at Skype, it's really hard to get to the point that you can actually communicate with someone and when I finally did they weren't helpful at all.  So I got in touch with Amazon, they were great and gave me a way to overcome the problems I've been having. Albeit a temporary fix.The problems I've had have included, not being able to sign in, the control panel disappearing so I cannot sign in or out (once signed out automatically there was no way to sign back in), see what credit I have or access my profile. Losing all records of any texts that I have sent and paid for. The programme constantly crashes.Having got home from travelling I have again contacted Skype to try and resolve the problem.  Several emails have been exchanged, they have collected data from me about the problem and now have closed the case without having resolved the problem at all. I have lost money because of the problems I've had, directly from my Skype credit, I shall never see that again.  Skype is a disgrace, if anything goes wrong with the programme they are useless, it appears to be a waste of time contacting them, they don't understand their own product.

Since Skype has been updated I've faced a bunch of problems. One problem is that the volume is high, it doesn't matter if I put the volume on zero I can still hear the person on the other line loudly. Another problem that I have is that as soon as you click on the app it signs in automatically. If someone was to click on my Skype they would be able to access my messages and contacts immediately.  I want my privacy. Another problem is that it continuously crashes for no apparent reason. One minutes it's working and the next it's sending you a message that says "Skype is not responding would you like to close it" if you say yes it closes and if you don't the message will continue to pop up. Before the update I also noticed that Skype would just hang up my calls and I thought it was my internet connection but after reading numerous reviews I realize that I'm not the only one with this problem. Skype needs to be fixed immediately. The company should fix all the glitches before putting it back in the Appstore.

Headings: Works Great on new Kindle Fire HD 7"
Base_Reviews: I got my new Kindle HD 7" yesterday.  I downloaded the SKYPE app.  This was the main reason that I upgraded from the original Kindle Fire.  I did a Skype session this afternoon with my daughter-in-law and grandbaby this afternoon.  Worked wonderful!  I had no problems whatsoever getting it working.  I already had a Skype account that I used on my desktop computer.  Logged in. D-I-L called and I answered with video...  was wonderful.  Good quality picture.  She sent me photos via Skype at the same time that we were video chatting.  They came through just fine. A really great App and for me, it was worth getting the Kindle Fire HD.  Thanks, Amazon and Skype.  Now I can Skype with them no matter where I am (as long as I can get wifi).

Works just like a phone. All you have to do is sign up. It will then ask for ur your phone number in which then  the app will give u a new one to use on your tablet. I wasnt really paying attention to see if you can get your tablet number without having a phone number but I think you can. Although you have limited usage for calling through credit, the texting is unlimited. Plus you can easily get some free credits by watching ad videos for 1 or 2 credits. Sometimes it double the credits on certain days. A credit counts for 1 minute and u have 10 starting out.  Its syncs perfectly with contactsas as well. No problems here, but I would like to have some more customizable features. Like the theme color being purple and etc. My number reason for getting this app is because my mom refuses to get me a smart phone so I have a tracfone. I was able to send messages to other tracfone as well but it is compatible with all phones. I use this app on my kindle hdx and I will hope that you consider giving this app a try.

I got my kindle about a year ago, and had this great idea. My grandmother is in another state, and I'm lucky to see her once a year, and call her once a week. So, why not use my kindle and text her? I tried many apps, but, they either, had bugs and viruses, or cost money. The credits are an issue, but videos and offers help with that. I have over 1,000 credits,all from doing offers. The sms and texting work amazing. All you have to do is click on new message and type in the phone number. One problem I see is that once you text one person to much, which took me a year to accomplish, they won't let you anymore. But, anyhow, you CAN change the name of the person, and their picture. Just go to contacts, ( a different app) and put the phone number into a contact, name them, and give them a picture. It should update when you next power off and on your device.

This is a pretty cool app for the situation in our household.  My wife and I, both in our early forties, are disabled and therefore are together most of the time.  Because of this we share a phone seeing no need to add the expense of another phone.  But now when the wife is gone we can keep in contact not needing to worry about one another's well being.  And it's FREE!! How cool is that?The only issue we have had is with voice calls.  When using voice the person on the other end cannot be heard on the Kindle.  They can hear me just fine.  Don't know if I'm doing something wrong or what.  I wonder if others have this issue?  Haven't attempted video yet so can't comment.The voice issue aside I think this is a great app!  I've already recommended it to several folks.

I might need this for 2-step verification. So I chose the "free" app. But that's a lie. It's not free. To get a single text, it's $4. That's not nearly free. That's a ripoff. I could go to a dollar store and get a burner phone for ten dollars per month and get unlimited texts. But I don't want a cell phone. I suppose in the days of two-step verifications, that means I won't be able to function online any more. I certainly won't choose to deal with a company that lies about its price. That should not be allowed, and Amazon should remove their app from the Fire store. False advertising is wrong. Poor value is wrong. I have no idea why there are positive reviews here. All paid for, I assume.

Headings: The program is easy to use, but do not feel you get your money's worth

For the price I don't feel I should have to do that. Also things like forgetting my password was such a chore to correct. I am learning but it is a bit of a struggle. You just need to weigh your pros and cons I guess. I do not think I will renew my subscription.

Headings: Good app for tablets, but you'll need a pricey subscription to go past lesson 1.
Base_Reviews: As a mobile app, it's very useful on a tablet. On smaller devices, the forced landscape mode I wouldn't like as much. Speech recognition works well enough using the device mic, but I'd recommend a headset for more consistent results. The writing exercises are not supported on mobile devices, at least on FireOS and Android. No idea about IOS.You get one lesson free as a demo, then to continue you must subscribe. Rosetta Stone is not cheap, but their pricing model has changed recently and it's not as expensive as it was when I first looked at it years ago. I've used Duolingo and Memrise and I like them both very much, but I prefer Rosetta Stone's method and find it more effective for my learning style. I'll use the others on my phone, and stick to RS on my computer and tablet.

Headings: FranÃÂ§ais avec un accent du sud
Base_Reviews: Bonjour amis,I love this app. I will be leaving for Paris, France in four days and the Duolingo owl and I have become fast friends. I have mastered a few words and phrases, such as Bonjour, Merci, Au revoir, OÃÂ¹ suis-je? (Where am I?) Plus vin s'il vous plaÃÂ®t (More wine, please, Pouvez-vous rÃÂ©pÃÂ©ter? (Can you repeat that?) and other helpful phrases.The only negative is repeating phrases into the microphone. I swear, I sounded perfected to me, but the *#% owl always hooted, " Doesn't sound quiet right. Let's try again later." So, If you're wondering about the title of this review, I'll  translate, " French with a Southern twang".No worries, Duolingo and I going to have so much fun in Paris and I dare say so are the Parisians.

Although the app has a few quirks, it is a wonderful way to get started learning another language. I would rather have given it a 4.5, but that's not available. Not all the translations are exact, but those are few. It's main downfall for me (and perhaps I just didn't know where to look) was there is no list of the varied conjugations (soy eres es somos son) that allows you to study the various verb and word forms before you are just thrown into the water to learn to swim. But it's free and will teach by repetition if you have the time and stick-to-it-ness.

Headings: Best free language app on the market!
Base_Reviews: I have been mixing and matching several language apps and this is by far the best. I try to use it 15 minutes every day and I am making real progress towards fluency.

I am having some trouble with the native speaker's accent however. Even when I slow it down, she doesn't always pronounce things the way I am expecting, like pronouncing "Nauge" for "Mange". There are other examples which I can't think of off-hand as well. The other thing I don't like are the daily reminders to study. I can't do this everyday. I have other obligations but I will keep at it as I have the time and I really don't need the "nagging". Other than that... so far, so good.

Headings: Duolingo excellent for learning a foreign language!

Duolingo just makes it fun to learn, and I would certainly recommend this program to anyone who wants to be fluent in another foreign language.

This app is great for students that are taking Spanish and need to study every night. Headings: There are many different skills like reading, speaking
Base_Reviews: Learning a language has always been difficult for me but has been made much easier with Duolingo.  There are many different skills like reading, speaking, and translating required by the user and that makes learning fun and helps "set" words in my mind.
Guaoooo very good!

I lived in Francophone countries for several years and studiedFrench using a very rigid US Govt-developed "listen/repeat" method that might have been the best in the world, but didn't work for me. I needed to see the words, to see how they fit into sentences, and to help build up a decent vocabulary. Now, 25 years later, in an effort to keep up my rusty French, I started DuoLingo and am astounded at the improvement in my comprehension and vocabulary. A lot of useful words are introduced early on and one must listen to them, read them, write them and use them in sentences. This system is fun to use and it clearly will teach one a language. Five Stars.

Good app for free but I think it needs some development work...I can already speak Spanish but some of the translations are irritating in that there are so few alternatives allowed and the woman speaks South American Spanish so the machine does not accept some Castillian Spanish words and constantly wants you to use formal you (ustedes) which is normal in S.America but not in Spain.  Also sometimes only American English not British is accepted. The most irritating thing for a translator is that some of the translations are too literal or even inaccurate...nobody in Spanish says Yo quiero...they say Quiero. From a language point of view the grammar translation method is actually very old and many of the sentences may well not be useful.  All this said, it is quite fun to play with and somewhat addictive. Will be trying some other languages!
not bad
Great little app
Reminds me a lot of Rosetta Stone's products. All are very good.

So far, I'm really enjoying the way this app submerses you into the language and forces you to remember how the verb in particular ends rather than list is like language classes do. The app helped me learn the languages faster than it did with an actual teacher. The learning is personal and if you fail out of the lesson, you have to start that lesson over and I like this since the questions aren't in the same order, so it's not totally just memorize the right answer to pass. You're still learning and it's great!My only complaint is, I took three years of French and started using the French portion to get better at my listening skills, since that's where I do poorly, and sometimes the translations are wrong, or vastly differ from what I learned. For example the app teaches you instantly that jolie and joli mean lovely or nice, which in fact the word means 'pretty'. I know it's similar, but it threw me off since 'bonne' was also an option and that fits 'nice' better than 'jolie' does... Just my opinion...Anyway, once I got passed that, the French portion became easier and I was able to skip ahead using the skip ahead feature so if you know basics, you're not stuck completely relearning them!So far, this is the best learning tool I've found to help me learn new languages and I would really love to see more languages added~!!

I took french classes back in high school (many, many years ago) and I had forgotten just how difficult learning French can be. I've even tried Rosetta Stone and had no success. This program is like learning in the classroom again. It gives you lessons you need to complete, then sort of a practice test at the end of each group of lessons, then you can test out after the group of lessons as well. I have really enjoyed this program. I am not speaking fluently yet, but I am having a great time learning. J'aime Duolingo!

Headings: If you are serious about learning a language, check out Duolingo and prepare to work everyday.
Base_Reviews: When you make a mistake be sure to go to the red flag for comments. There are a lot of smart people who can explain the grammar involved and help you understand if this is something native speakers intuitively understand or if you need to send a flag to Duolingo. Sometimes the conversation gets a bit off track even if it is interesting. The only reason I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars is because it would be helpful to have some how to use the program tips before you start. (How to type in accents, different alphabets, etc.) Overall this is an outstanding free program that offers many languages and works to keep you motivated with a quirky sense of humor.

Headings: Not going to make you fluent, but at least equivalent to school education

That doesn't say much when you think of foreign language programs in public schools, but it's impressive for an app. I think this app would be excellent to help students in such classes, and I enjoy it as a refresher course. I will say that it helps me to understand the language better, as it's not being spoken by someone who speaks it as a second language.

Headings: A little lacking, but otherwise good.
Base_Reviews: I originally downloaded this app to help me brush up on my French, which is pretty rusty after 15 years of little to no use, and my Spanish, which is just a little rusty after a year of little to no use. I am somewhat pleased with this app. I don't like it as much as I like my French and Spanish classes, but as far as a language tutor, it's great. The only thing lacking in this app is that it doesn't explain the conjugations of verbs with respect to pronouns. For instance--and I'm going to use Spanish as an example here--it doesn't explain why the verb 'ser' gets conjugated to 'eres' when you say "tu eres," or why it gets conjugated to 'somos' when you say, "nosotros somos." If it explained the process of conjugation for each language, that would make the app SO MUCH better and also help newbies have a fuller understanding of the language they are trying to learn. Anyone who doesn't know the first thing about other languages is going to think that this app is great, but if you are like me and you have had formal classes before, you will know that this app is seriously lacking. Formal classes give you the fundamental principles of the language to help you, and one of those fundamentals is learning conjugation so that you will not only understand what you're saying, but WHY you're saying it that way. I know this app isn't the same as a formal class, but if the developers are going to market it as an alternative to expensive formal classes, then they need to at least offer better teaching tools within the app.

There are subtle differences but the brilliant content is the same. There are a few things that pair nicely with Duolingo but this should be the one you go to for the real deal. I am shocked this is free, because it is so much better than anything else. I can only hope Duolingo continues to improve and expand.

Headings: One of the best language-learning apps I've seen so far
Base_Reviews: This is an excellent app and an excellent website. I've been a language learner for over 40 years, and Duolingo is one of the best facilitators I've seen. It combines some of the best aspects of its predecessors, like Rosetta and Mango, but it's free (!), and it's very entertaining (it keeps you translating sentences like "I'm a horse, and I speak English"), and it reminds you when you need refresher work. I've only been using it for a short time, but it's excellent for learning the bones of a language. I don't think it's for the weekend traveler; it doesn't give you the hello/how are you stuff. It concentrates on vocabulary and grammar (in a fun non-schoolroom way). So, if you just want to learn Please and Thank you and How are you?, buy a phrasebook. If you're going to be in Norway / Spain / France / Germany for a month or so, try Duolingo. It will entertain you and educate you, and give you what you need.

I downloaded this app to my Kindle Fire.  I have only been using it for a few days but, for the most part, i am pleased with it. It is easy to use and lots of great recipes.  I like the fact that you can save a recipe to your 'Recipe Box' and it will create the shopping list for you.  No need to write everything down.  In order to save a recipe you have to first create an account with Food Network, but that is simple.The only complaint I have is when I find a recipe I like while searching on the Kindle I cannot save it to my Recipe Box.  When I try I receive an error message.  In order to save it I have to go to my computer and sign on to my Food Network account, search for the recipe and save it from there.

Headings: If you love to cook this is the app for you.

I have not used all the functions yet mainly because I cannot stop watching Pioneer Women but when I do I will be sure to update.The mobile app is definitely handy for taken your watching on the go.UPDATE: IÃ¢â¬â¢ve used all functions provided by the app and I can honestly say I really enjoy this app especially the classes they are easy to follow along with and very informative. I really love the fact that all of the ingredients, cook times and all materials used in the videos are listed below the video so you can give it a quick glance before starting the video to prep everything beforehand and all youÃ¢â¬â¢ll have to do once you are ready to watch is follow along.All the live videos are done in real time (even if you do not watch them when they are currently live). They have recipes to fit everyoneÃ¢â¬â¢s taste even the really picky ones. I love the fact that a lot of the recipes are rated so you can see what people like and didnÃ¢â¬â¢t like about the recipes.During the live feature if you catch one during the time itÃ¢â¬â¢s actually live (schedules are provided) you can ask questions wit the Q&A button and if you are lucky the host will answer it. If not donÃ¢â¬â¢t feel bad the question will get answered as they have professional standing by to answers questions that do not get answered by the host.I hope this review was helpful. Happy cooking!

I was looking forward to using this app, based on some reviews. Finally one place to compile all my recipes! Alas, there is one huge flaw with this app...there is no backup or storage of your recipes in the Cloud.  Lose or change your device and your data goes with it, unless you back it up. But you know you will slack on backing this up regularly, offline. So much management. Additionally the larger your recipe stash gets, the more space is eaten up on your device.  Also don't expect there to be sync'ing between your phone and tablet for example, since there is no cloud storage or account to login to and sync.I will save and revisit this app at a later date. I would like to see a one time pay, no ads, cloud capable app. Until then I will continue to keep my recipes in Evernote, which has all capabilities this app lacks.

Headings: I USED to love this app
Base_Reviews: Up until today, I rated this app as 4 or 5 stars.  I loved it for my Kindle Fire and started using it almost exclusively when cooking.  Today, however, when I went to open my recipes, it wouldn't open.  Instead, it showed a message saying that all my recipes were there waiting for me and I could see them just as soon as I upgraded the app!I had already decided that I didn't want to upgrade because I had seen that the upgrade changed the permissions, adding some more chancy ones that I saw no need for.  So now they are holding my recipes hostage unless I upgrade to the new permissions!This wouldn't be so bad if all I had in there were recipes I'd imported from the net, but there were several I'd developed myself and I really hate to lose them.  But I also don't like giving into blackmail.Update 11/25/12 - I've upgraded my review from 2 to 3 stars. The company was responsive to our dislike of some of the permissions and backed off a bit and I gave in and upgraded because I really like this app.  I love having all my recipes with me on my Kindle Fire and not having to print recipes from the net when I want to use them. NICE!I DO NOT like the ads they've added.  I understand they need to make money, but personally, I would rather just pay for the app than have the ads. This and concern about permissions is why I still rate this app as 3 rather than 5 star.
I DO NOT REMEMBER WHEN, WHERE, WHY, WHAT THIS WAS USED ON MY KINDLE, I'M A GREAT COOK, DON'T EVEN KNOW WHERE TO FIND the chef

I love this app.  It works perfectly on my kindleFire.  Easily and flawlessly copies recipes from various sources on the web -- even from cooking blogs where there is a lot of nonrecipe verbiage.  Also appreciate the step-by-step instructions with split screen displaying ingredients on one side and instructions on the other.  Ability to edit recipes and categorize/tag each recipe according to preferences is another bonus.  All around impressive!  Many thanks to the creators!  ChefTap is already one of my most useful and favorite apps.

I am astounded that there are not more reviews on this app! As a chef it is wonderful for keeping, collecting, and tweaking my recipes. As a homecook, it is great to have at your fingertips. The sync-ability to the popular allrecipes and epicurious is an added bonus. So thankful this is free.

Headings: $20 PER YEAR AND Different PRO features for different platforms? No thanks
Base_Reviews: I'm very disappointed in this. This has great reviews, but it's really not all that great. I registered on my kindle. I went to the website to input all my recipes (there's only about 50, so I have room on the free account) from my browser bookmarks. But the "CLIP" feature on the website is only for PRO users. But I can enter them in all by hand. On the Kindle app, it's opposite. The CLIP feature is free and the manual entry is a PRO feature. So now, what I wanted it for, it's useless unless I want to spend a few hours inputting everything. There's no reason why the PRO features should be different from one platform to the next if you're offering a sync method to begin with. On top of all of that, I didn't realize it was $20 A YEAR. That's way too much when my good old card holder and recipe cards have barely cost $20 in TEN YEARS.

I was an early, and enthusiastic user of this app, and encouraged many of my friends and family to use this app...However, of late, the technical support has really declined...I've also had an issue where the recipe count doesn't match between  my Android device and the website...I was finally  told that it isn't they don't want to fix it, but "t's not that I can't fix it; It's that I'm at the end of a major feature development cycle (meal planning and menus) and all fixes going forward will be applied to the that version of ChefTap."...I responded back to this on 05/31/19 asking when this was going to occur, but have yet to get any kind of response back...Why should I use (and pay) for an app when I can't get a timely response to inquiries/questions or issue?

I LOVE this app.  It makes my life so much easier.  There are a few quirks here and there but the folks at Chef Tap truly want to hear about any issues and they actually respond and do their best to fix them right away or as soon as possible.  As for people who complain about having to pay for the app after clipping so many recipes, it is absolutely worth it. The price is nominal if you think about it and you get so much for your money.  I can scale recipes reducing human error, I can create shopping lists and a 'make list' so I don't forget what I wanted to fix.  I have lost beloved recipes in my home countless times... well no more.  They are right there on my phone and computer AND they are organized.  You can search for things in countless ways if you use the tags.  I just can't say enough about this app.  It is free to try and if you don't like all of the convenience and organization it can bring to your life then you don't have to buy it.  But for those of us that need it, it is well worth the current $1.60 per month.  Highly recommend!

Headings: Pro satisfaction guarantee! Unless, of course, you pay with your apple account. Not so smart shopping lists.

Pro would be a really good free version! Deleting my account and not wasting my time trying to get a refund.

Headings: Perfect for Treasured Recipes and those you want to try!

I've yet to find a glitch.  Only problem is, I just got an iPad and so far I do not see that there is an app for Apple!  Please help I must have this app!

And they just keep improving it to boot.Cons: It will not do my dinner "prep work".....you know all that chopping & measuring!

the sole reason i purchased a tablet was to organize my hundreds of recipes. i discovered cheftap & installed it immediately. after several updates, it runs fantastic. creators are always fine-tuning it & making it better. you cannot manually input your own recipes but you merely save recipes you find online...all you have to do is a couple of taps & the recipe is saved forever. there are other apps where you can input personal recipes. overall, i love this app.

Headings: Best Recipe Storage App out there for Android

Any problem I had, I emailed them and within less than 24 hours I had an answer and lots of additional tips. Thanks for being so great!!!

So I could manage my recipes on my desktop computer when I don't have my tablet on hand. Then this would be PERFECT! Kinda like the "Out of Milk" app that I use for my grocery shopping..just an idea. :)

So I wanted to enjoy my holiday weekend and not sit at my desk in front of a computer for 4-5 hours. I had a web-based class that you could work at your own speed and watch the videos. I was able to pull up the website on my ipad and screen mirror onto my tv and watch there. I was able to get through a class that I had been putting off for the last 30 days within 3.5 hours in the comfort of my bed! And I was still able to take notes on my phone. Loved this!

Headings: The best Android AirPlay receiver I have ever used
Base_Reviews: I installed AirScreen on my Fire Stick 1st Gen and was able to screen mirror my MacBook Pro and iPhone SE within minutes without a hitch. This app looks clean and professional, and the streaming is smooth and close to the performance of an actual Apple TV. It even runs in the background so that the app does not need to be opened for AirPlay to be launched, just like the real thing! My only qualm is that the paid version is subscription-basedÃ¢â¬âI'd rather make a one-time purchase or buy an actual Apple TV.

Headings: Avoid the CBS Sports app for now...(downloaded for superbowl 2016).
Base_Reviews: It was laggy. What I mean is that I ran it on my fire tv stick specifically to watch the superbowl and the pre-game stuff leading up to it. The audio was multiple seconds behind the video which made it difficult because entire sentences where spoke before I actually heard them.  I thought maybe if I restart that would clear it up. Sadly no. The app was bad enough I just went ahead and used my over the air antenna instead. I wanted this app to work well. But it did not. I cannot recommend it at this time as a result. I suggest steer clear of this application. It was made available for the superbowl and failed.

Headings: Great app, wish the other networks would offer similar
Base_Reviews: We use an antenna for most of our television reception, and augment this with our Amazon Fire TV.  There are times when our antenna reception is not all that good (rural, mountainous area), and these times often coincide with sporting events that I would like to watch.  I downloaded the CBS Sports app a bit before Superbowl 50, and watched the game with the app on our Fire TV.  The picture quality was excellent, and we are very happy.  Free app, how do you beat that?  Hey Fox, NBC, and ABC:  follow CBS' lead!

This app works perfectly, and I enjoyed being able to watch the super bowl.  The only problem was the delay.  I was talking with another person on the phone while watching, and they were very much ahead of what I was seeing.  That's not a major problem, but it did take away whatever little suspense there was in the game.

WAY too complicated.  The whole experience was a giant headache.  Get it together, CBS.

Headings: Fix this and it's easily a 5 star app in my book
Base_Reviews: I'm using this app with the Amazon fire tv and it normally works well (requires cable or satellite password). However lately it has been automatically switching back and forth between different programs.  I tend to watch the angels and clippers and it constantly switches back and forth without any button presses.  It gets to the point where all it does is buffer since it's trying to switch back and forth every couple seconds.  Fix this and it's easily a 5 star app in my book.  Also,  it would be nice if they could provide a paid service  for those of us without satellite or cable plan.

Headings: is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team
Base_Reviews: Just purchased new Amazon FireTV Stick and first app I installed is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team. Unfortunately, regardless of what live game or show I watch on this app, it consistently freezes and then continues and repeats that process, at least once or twice a minute. I can run Fox Sports Go app on my iPhone connected to the same WiFi router and it works without ever freezing or delay. I have 100Mb fiber connection with AT&T and a NightHawk wireless router. I get consistent download speeds of ~125Mb and under 10ms for latency, so its not the network (first thing that is blamed). I've watched shows on Amazon Prime on the same FireTV stick without any issues. I've restarted the FireTV stick, and even re-installed the Fox Sports Go app, no change.

Headings: FoxSports GO demanding provider, then UserID & PW, but won't accept UserID
Base_Reviews: Today, and today only, SAT 2015-10-31, FOX Sports GO won't let me log on.  It pops for me to select my provider, then enter a UserID & PW, but won't accept my UserID.  I checked w/my provider and UserID is fine, and can log onto their website fine. This is not a password issue. Since it's ONLY FOX Sports GO that does this (I can access ESPN and all others checked via Amazon Fire TV Stick fine), I'm presuming this to be a Fox Sports GO issue.  That, or the app has been hacked by a phishing app of some kind.  Can't watch OU today, that's a BIG deal in Oklahoma.

Headings: A good start on an NBC sports app, but with plenty of room for improvement.
Base_Reviews: The NBC sports app is a huge improvement over the prime-time coverage, but the app still needs work. It can be difficult to navigate among events; the olympics ended up being a single string of several thousand individual events, with no search option, and a paucity of informative labeling. To recognize the individual sports you had to identify the thumbnail image -- there was no accompanying text describing the event. Playback was generally good, with nice high resolution imagery, but from time to time the feed would fail or compression artifacts would interfere. I don't have any trouble with this streaming most video, so I have to assume it is the app or (more likely) the back-side server. There is no option to watch an event part way and then return to it at the same point, and searching and scrolling functions are awkward. Still, despite these problems, this is how I chose to watch the Olympics; the prime time broadcast is dead to me.

Headings: Great app to use with IP cameras as baby monitor
Base_Reviews: We purchased this app to use with our IP camera baby monitors and it works pretty well.  It is a little cumbersome to program the camera settings but the app works great otherwise.  It lets you choose from a couple different display layouts but we always use the side by side.  The refresh rate is quick enough that we can usually see what's happening within 1 sec of it happening.  Other apps we've used can have a several second delay.  My only complaint it that it isn't available on the Apple App Store and therefore we can't use it on all of our devices.
Glad I didn't pay for it.  Its 'ok' but I guess its not something I really needed.So, neither positive nor negative.

Headings: why buy a $$250+ baby monitor? when you can have an even better system for less!
Base_Reviews: This was my husband's idea and I could not be happier! We started using this camera when our baby boy was born, the great thing is that we can log in from anywhere (cellphone, computer at work, from overseas when traveling) and still be able to check on our baby. with this camera you are able to listen, watch, speak, set motion sensors and infrared light and alarms to be sent to your email account. It works with a wifi connection, so be aware that the wifi/network must be on at all times. If you what a backup plan I would recommend buying a cheap audio monitor. We got this one NTM-910YIC - Sony Baby Call Nursery Monitor. Now we own 2 more... one for our dog and it works great when we are not home!

Headings: Works Fine To Let FireTV Receive iPhone Screen Streaming
Base_Reviews: I needed to screen mirror my iPhone to my FireTV. This turned out to be the best solution. You can get the free ad supported version and if you donÃ¢â¬â¢t mind the ads (I donÃ¢â¬â¢t) you are all set. The $1.99 upgrade price seems pretty reasonable and IÃ¢â¬â¢d go for that if I used it more than once in a blue moon.One caveat: make sure you have a good WiFi or LAN cable (FireTV classic or cube) connection for BOTH the sending and receiving devices and it runs fast enough (itÃ¢â¬â¢s not just signal strength you know, interference from other networks matters too).IÃ¢â¬â¢m giving this app 5 stars. It solved a real problem in a pretty darn painless way.

Headings: This really works with IPhones!  No hassle or hardware.
Base_Reviews: I have tried sever of these mirroring apps including the internal app on my Samsung 72Ã¢â¬ï¿½TV and for whatever reason I could never get it to work with I phones.  This is the first one that literally mirrors your phone screen.  ChromeCast  works for things that have casing ability but not showing movies and pictures on your phone.  Any video on the web or Facebook is exactly mirrored on this app.It does require the app to be open on the TV and on the phone but when you hit broadcast within 5 seconds your phone screen appears on your TV.

This app seemed okay at first. It even gave me a free trial to see how I liked it. And initially, it did what I needed. Or so I thought. The Ã¢â¬Åfree trialÃ¢â¬ï¿½ is actually only about five minutes long, which wasnÃ¢â¬â¢t enough time to test the sound. (I am actually not clear whether you CAN test the sound in the trial, because thatÃ¢â¬â¢s how quickly it went by.) So I foolishly paid the $9.99 for the full version. Did the sound work then? Headings: Get this if you enjoy being frustrated and miserable
Base_Reviews: If you're looking to seamlessly mirror content from other devices to your TV to follow along exercise/dance videos, learn a new skill, or enjoy general entertainment on the big screen...this product isn't for you.However, if you would like to be constantly dissatisfied or disappointed, you've come to the right place! Enjoy the frequent buffering and frame skipping of an inferior product that will never be mentioned in the same breath of a ChromeCast, Apple TV, or Firestick. But who values reliability and quality anyways? Being constant is dull. AirBeam TV keeps things FRESH by spontaneously throwing in wrenches into your streamed content. This app will take your favorite videos and movies, and mindlessly chop-and-screw it until it devolves into a hot/disheveled mess that once resembled your original content. But hey, everyone loves a good remix. Remixes are awesome and always better than the original!And if you enjoy horrible customer service, you can always count on AirBeam TV to not be there for you. If you had questions or comments about the product, but are repulsed by the thought of talking to a human being, AirBeam TV will gladly send you through an infinite loop of automated responses while deferring all blame to the user. It's not enough that I've restarted my computer and modem, closed all other extensions/applications, and checked the internet connection of my TV...I probably need to give up my left kidney and bladder too for my video content to be streamed without a hitch.AirBeam TV's connectivity strength and resolution may be inconsistent, but your disappointment with the product will remain constant over time!

App works just fine. You need to download the app *both* for your FireTV or Fire Stick, as well as a .dmg file for your Mac.  Once both are installed and running, and both your Mac and FireTV are on the same wifi network, you will have an icon on the top bar on your Mac to connect your TV as a mirrored display.The Mac software is a free trial - runs for only about 5 minutes, so be ready to test-drive the things you want to mirror on your TV!  See if you like the results.  The purchase price for the Mac license is $9.99.For me there is about a 1-second lag between laptop and TV, which is fine for screen sharing with others in the room.  It's like teleconferencing software in that regard.  I have not used it yet for streaming video, but I have another app for that already.

This app barely works. It does send a picture to the TV, but it's low quality, constantly freezes and lags behind the source by up to a minute, despite 100Mg/s internet connection.  Expect frustration.

I now have both the AirbeamTV app for Samsung & the AirbeamTV app for Sony.  The customer service was fantastic, and the product(s) work equally well.  My older TVs became 'Smart' by adding Samsung and Sony Blu-Ray players, and the AirbeamTV app connects equally well to both, allowing me to project my ukulele play-along ipad software to the BIG SCREEN.  Great products, Great Service!!

Downloaded app and initially had problem getting video on Samsung TV linked to MAC.  Used diagnostic link on app, described problem and was surprised to get response within One minute!  Problem was my use of Safari as browser.  They suggested a couple of browsers and I tried a Firefox.  Fixed problem immediately.  Amazing to find company that is that responsive to customer needs.  Great job!

Headings: Works for an HP Photosmart 7510 (7515) printer on WiFi.
Base_Reviews: I wanted to print from my new Kindle Fire HD 7 directly to my HP WiFi printer.  HP has an app for this, but it does not work for my Kindle - yet.  Amazon tech folks are looking at this.In the meantime, the Amazon tech suggested a few apps that were compatible with my Kindle.  PrintBot is available and does print directly over WiFi to the printer.  It is not perfect, but it works.  As a test I found that I can easily print a web page, but if the page goes over a page of paper in size a line or two of text is lost.  With the free version, the graphics were just blanked out.  Anyway, this does give me the general functionality I want, and it is easy to use and set up.

Headings: It would certainly be useful for monitoring a child with sound from another room ...
Base_Reviews: As this indoor camera is so inexpensive I had not got high hopes for it but it has surprised me.  It comes with a small bracket that can be fixed to the wall.  I use it to monitor my aquarium with discus fish and it is ideal.  Anywhere in your house that has a wireless connection can be used to place the camera and to view it over the internet.  I am able to check on my aquarium from my daughter's house.  One can move the camera remotely and I have found by experiment that it will zoom and focus remotely as well.  The colour picture is low quality which one would expect at that price, but it is adequate and also had infra red illumination at night with black and white picture. I have not used the filming or alarm at movement; or the addition of a memory card. It would certainly be useful for monitoring a child with sound from another room but would not record pictures in high enough quality for evidence. I view the picture using Bluestacks on my Windows 10 computer as the software is Android.  There is a Windows app on their website4 but with no instructions, I could not get it to work on Windows 10.
To get benefits  you need to purchase the Pro, as the basic only gives you limited access to it usage

Headings: Free - get what you pay for.
Base_Reviews: While not super hard to use, not really user friendly either.  Sure wish it was like the ones you see the HGTV planners use.  Tried using this to map out a kitchen remodel and the lower cabinets would cover over the uppers and while I don't expect the sizing to be exact, some were way off.  Even just dragging or turning an object did not lend to desirable results.  While it was free, I guess you get what you pay for.

Headings: Don't waste your money or time on this free app.
Base_Reviews: Although the product will allow one to draw shapes and walls with their smartphone, the limited screen size prohibits adding much detail. Add to that the fact that everything is calibrated in metric units and the app is almost as useful as a piece of graph paper and a straightedge, which is what I'll be using instead.  If I could get it to load to my notepad or even my desktop AND WORK IN ENGLISH UNITS then I would be willing to pay for this.  As it is, using it on a smartphone is like building a ship in a bottle with ice tongs.

I've been using CAD programs since 1985 and this is most chunky unusable piece of crap I've come across.  I down loaded it to my Fire 10 with hopes of using it to put down ideas when I'm away from my computer and found that is was completely useless.  Anybody that's used CAD programs  knows that interruptions are disruptive to thinking and those advertisements do just that besides using valuable space on tiny screens.  Also the description says you can export them to a DXF file but you can't unless pay for an upgrade.  Setting the units and wall thickness to English units is possible but awkward.

Either I can't figure out how to use the help section or there's not much to it.  I really enjoyed using it but really need help resolving the above issues and I can't locate info on how to contact the creator except for rating it.  PLEASE let me know how to fix this!  I put a good deal of time into this already and don't want to lose my work.  I also don't want to have to pay for the watermark/ads feature to be removed again!

Unless you're working with whole feet, don't waste your time.

Every single thing is wrong with this company. To start with terrible customer service. It is basically a call center and nearly impossible to get ahold of anyone live. Once you do they are of no help. There are hidden fees you will most definitely find yourself charged with. There are many other companies out there providing good, honest streaming options. Fubo Tv is the worst. Wish I could give it negative stars. You have been warned.

The service is not the issue with my review. Fubo get's a 1 star review because even after I cancelled my subscription (which I have in writing) they still charged me. What is worse is when they charged me it was hitting a card that I rarely use so I wasn't able to catch it until after a few months. I wasn't sent any invoices via email, and when I tried to get a refund I was told no refunds can be issues because of terms of service. Again, the service and stream quality are fine, but beware of charges if you cancel your service.

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

Headings: It tricks you into a month of service
Base_Reviews: BE AWARE! I attempted to try the free week trial. Once I set up the trail period, I canceled, so I wouldn't get charged for a month and continue with the free week. Fubo, instead, wouldn't allow me to try the free week trial. I selected the trial again, but now was automatically signed up for a month ($77). Be aware that Fubo's user interface is tricky and will have you signing up for a month that you probably don't even want. I called customer service and they wouldn't reverse the charges.

Headings: Be careful when/if you cancel your subscription.
Base_Reviews: I had Fubo for the 2021/22 hockey season. It was a decent streaming service, but no longer became worth the price when they increased the cost dramatically. I accidently "paused" the service at the end of the hockey season instead of canceling it and during the off season I found cheaper ways to watch hockey (NESN) so I decided not to restart the service. Little did I know they would restart the service 6 months later without any notice and charged me $80. I called customer service and they said there was nothing they could do and refused any sort of refund. I'm sure they have the terms written and I honestly just screwed up when pausing instead of canceling, but restarting the service without some kind of notice and charging me 6 months later has certainly put me off the service permanently. A simple heads up email before restating the service and charging me would have been a much more honest business approach.
I was unable to use this app and am trying to unsubscribe. . . .with difficulty!

Headings: Terrible streaming, and user interaction  terrible
Base_Reviews: The streaming is so slow, on Comcast, Xfinity. In addition to that IÃ¢â¬â¢m supposed to learn new toggles, supposed to your typical back and forward, stop toggles. Terrible platform. The only reason I paid for this platform was because I wanted to watch Yellowstone.I will not sign up. I should not be the one intuitive one, but it should be the platform making it easy for the user.

I signed up for the free trial, to see if it was worthwhile for my husband (he watches every sport imaginable).  The first game he watched was Notre Dame, and the app had a picture delay... so we heard the play well before we saw the play.  We tried everything to fix it, to no avail.  I called customer service & they told me that there was no problem with their app & I should "just watch something else".  I'm sure you can guess how that comment went over with a diehard ND fan... The next day he tried again, only this time I could not even get the app to load.  So I called customer service AGAIN, except this time I was not nearly as friendly.  I told them that I wanted the subscription cancelled & my credit card information destroyed.  They told me that I had to request cancellation via email... WHICH I DID!!  Fast forward two weeks.  They charged my credit card for the subscription, which I cancelled over the phone AND by email.  I AGAIN called customer service and was told that I had not cancelled the subscription, but that they would "see if they could refund the money".  It wasn't ling before they told me that they would not refund the money AND I had to go through the cancellation process again.  I disputed the charge with my credit card and informed my credit card company that if they attempted to charge my card again it was fraud & I wanted to press charges.  They are currently fighting with my credit card company... so, the only thing I can say about Fubo TV is BUYER BEWARE!!!  It is not worth the headache for the crappy service they provide.

Can't login.  TV prompts me to login from computer or phone.  Laptop puts me in an endless loop to login.  No help.  This is worse than sling.  Technology is too easy to make it this hard.  No help from Amazon, either, either, in cancelling this order!

Headings: If you thought cable was bad, wait til you try fubo!
Base_Reviews: Oh where to start.....World Cup France v Morocco, oops, Fubo not available.  What???  Customer service, after an hour wait, suggested I watch on Fox streaming for free.  Fox only allows 60 minutes before you need to use your tv subscriber info, which didn't work with fubo.  ha ha...TV app is worthless.  Buffering with 1000mbps and new tv?  Will not rewind or fast forward on recorded shows.  You can watch on your big screen if you stream from iPhone to tv.  It isn't perfect though.Nevertheless, I imagine the slugs who took the company public are laughing all the way to the bank.I suggest shorting the stock (which would have been a great idea earlier in the year as the stock price is hovering around $2 and some change), you may be able to make back some of your subscription fees!Lastly, I do feel sorry for the customer service reps.  I am sure they get an earful daily.  I have had some nice ones in all fairness.All the best,FubismalPS: can't wait to I see my credit card continue to get charged after I cancel, which I have yet to experience, but the majority of reviews seem to allude to Fubo's inability to cancel accounts. Should be more fun!

Overall, the service is not bad, and they do provide a nice list of channels. However, where they really fail is the ability to watch what you have saved on their Cloud DVR.  During the day, the system response is pretty good, but at about 8:00 PM (Eastern US time) through 11:00 PM, the ability to view saved shows is virtually impossible!  The system gives you the spinning wheel repeatedly, which indicates the streaming servers are not able to keep up with demand.  This happens every single week night!  And what's worse is that support does not respond to requests for help!

I purchased fuboTV primarily to watch football. For that purpose, it did its job; however, overall it left a lot to be desired. The streaming quality itself was OK, with an occasional buffer, which was mildly disappointing. My biggest problem though was with the UI and the price. The price that fubo charges rivals Hulu Live and YouTube TV and yet the interface is not even close. Additionally, it seemed like the library was minuscule at best. Looking at the movie tab, for example, and it would show me maybe 10 options (all of which were live and nearing the end of the program). If you want to cancel it was difficult to find where to manage the subscription and it asks you if you are sure at least 3 times. I have used almost every streaming app and continue to use most of them as they each bring something to the table. Fubo did almost nothing to distinguish itself and for that reason I couldnÃ¢â¬â¢t justify paying for it any longer.
