Headings: Deceptive and absolutely cancerous after installation.
Base_Reviews: Not all fire tvs are the same... Some are super simple to cast to, others require third party applications.. The program doesn't tell you its just a free trial and will abruptly end the stream in the middle and tell you to subscribe to continue. It isn't even that great, it was lousy and kept buffering and lagging every few minutes.Now here's the real crap part, if you try to cast using Chromecast or anything that your tv USE TO BE ABLE TO DO without anything else... It intercepts these and tries to force you to use it for these as well!! Even if you literally can't because your not a paying customer! I tried to ignore it and manually selected the program I actually wanted to use...and then 30 minutes later it forced itself onto my tv interrupting my show by reopening itself! I had to completely uninstall the garbage because even when not running, ITS RUNNING.avoid at all costs. Overpriced, deceptive, malicious junk that tries to take over your tv!

Headings: Nice upgrade to not so smart TV
Base_Reviews: My curved Samsung TV does not have AirPlay. Buying a fire stick and downloading this app allowed me to export sound and video from my MacBook Air. Video quality is decent but audio lags terribly. I export video only and use Bluetooth instead for audio. Works like a charm with that arrangement. Connectivity is ok; sometimes it takes a while to identify available devices on the network. The software on my Boot Camp windows 10 partition sometimes crashes. Unfortunately this software is subscription based (yearly). This was a nice workaround to upgrade my TV connectivity capabilities. Thank you to person who posted this idea in a forum somewhere (clever).

I needed to decipher some video footage from my security camera, so ai wanted to watch it on my huge Fire TV. I saw this app, and tried it - and it worked like a charm! It was super easy to use, and there was no distortion in the tv images. Recommend!

Headings: Absolutely horrible interface and regular crashing
Base_Reviews: I have had this service for over 8 months.  In that time, the amount of recorded shows that had technical difficulties and crashed without recording the rest of the episode or having to start all over and find where it crashed is substantial.  And they only carry the locally covered NHL games so if you are a hockey fan, this is a terrible option.  Ultimately, this service drove me nuts and was extremely more frustration than an actual "service".  The only benefit it had over some other services (ie. Youtube TV) is that they are actual recordings that you can fast forward and skip commercials (as long as it doesn't crash the interface which happens regularly).  Otherwise, trying to figure out how to run the interface was and still is a complete nightmare.  At least on an LG smart TV.  I have to scroll up to get to a menu 6 or 7 times before it actually does it.  The UI is completely unintuitive and a nightmare to figure out.  Even when you finally figure out the completely unintuitive actions you have to take to pull up a menu while watching a show, you have to do it over and over and over before it actually does it.  The frustration level with this service is way beyond what its worth at one of the highest price points of all streaming services.  I highly recommend anyone who's considering this to just move on to the next service on your list.  This one is terrible.

Headings: They continually remove some of the best channels that you prob signed up for
Base_Reviews: Loved this service when I first signed up!  The channel line up was unmatched to other streaming platforms.  First they removed the entire  Lifetime/A&E channel family, which was a huge bummer!!  Then this new year, they removed the entire AMC family b/c they are looking to be more "sports" oriented.  This is so upsetting to have the channels just removed & there isn't even an option to upgrade & add the channels back.  Its no longer part of their service, period.  Disappointing & will prob be looking for a different platform after this.  If they want to be more sports focused they should offer a sports upgrade package for those specific customers.  Not punish all their other customers w a blanket removal of services.

I signed up for this Service in the fall of 2021.  After using the service two times I promptly closed the account.  The service did not have the NFL games I wanted to see.  FuboTV continued to bill me erratically - they billed me a year later and again recently in dec. 22 and just again in jan 23.  I called them - they said my account was still open - and even if it was (I'm sure I closed account) their billing was still erratic and incorrect.  I disputed with my bank - twice.  During the call with FuboTV they said I could not receive a refund because their system did not allow them to do that.  Watch your bank statements closely if you are a subscriber because although my account was closed they tried to bill me almost two years later.  And if you cancel - watch your accounts even closer.

Headings: So tired of media & itÃ¢â¬â¢s pitiful skeevy politics. Sorry to see fubo jumpin on the bandwagon
Base_Reviews: I record Tucker Carlson Tonight & usually catch it the next day, if not at the time he airs. Usually his newest episode are on the top of the list but since the new year has arrived, fubo has the list completely out of order & now TuckerÃ¢â¬â¢s newest episodes are in the middle of a list of recordings, starting in October last year, unlabeled & incredibly hard to find. Why???  It is funny that hubs can watch Seinfeld or the Simpson or anything else, with absolutely no troubles at all, but try to watch Fox News or even catch a live football game, & you will be beyond frustrated. Think they should worry about making a better streaming service & stay out of the politics, youÃ¢â¬â¢re much better at reruns. My family is always on the fence about keeping our fubo subscription. It has been useful for now, but far from trouble less.

I signed up for a 30 day free trial on Fubo December 14, 2022. This also happened to be the day they were hacked. I hadn't gotten around to checking it out until today, December 31, 2022. As it turns out, Fubo unilaterally cancelled my account on December 19th after only 5 days. After a 30 minute hold with customer service, I was told that they couldn't "reinstate my free trial", even though I literally had never signed in or used it and I have an email confirmation that it is active until January 13th, 2023.I understand that computer glitches happen, and they can't override the computer so I asked for a comped month to make up for it. Apparently there is nothing in their system that allows for comps, either.Fubo definitely has a way to go before they can truly compete with the big boys (cable, YouTubetv, HuluLive)

Headings: Scam - They change your billing and dummy cancel your subscription
Base_Reviews: FuboTV is a scam. They updated my purchase by double charging me for the same service then when I tried to cancel they told me it was cancelled and merged the charges and then continued to charge me a higher rate and service while simultaneously locking me out of my account. When I tried to login the webpage said my account was deactivated and they then proceeded to charge me for 2 more months. The entire time I was complaining to customer service with receipts and confirmations that my account was cancelled yet I was still being charged. Customer service was useless taking days to respond via email and the phone line disconnected during multiple calls and when I asked for a refund they just replied with "you have access to service until next month enjoy". DO NOT GIVE GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY OR CARD INFO OR THEY'LL STEAL YOUR MONEY.

Overall, the service is not bad, and they do provide a nice list of channels. However, where they really fail is the ability to watch what you have saved on their Cloud DVR.  During the day, the system response is pretty good, but at about 8:00 PM (Eastern US time) through 11:00 PM, the ability to view saved shows is virtually impossible!  The system gives you the spinning wheel repeatedly, which indicates the streaming servers are not able to keep up with demand.  This happens every single week night!  And what's worse is that support does not respond to requests for help!

I purchased fuboTV primarily to watch football. For that purpose, it did its job; however, overall it left a lot to be desired. The streaming quality itself was OK, with an occasional buffer, which was mildly disappointing. My biggest problem though was with the UI and the price. The price that fubo charges rivals Hulu Live and YouTube TV and yet the interface is not even close. Additionally, it seemed like the library was minuscule at best. Looking at the movie tab, for example, and it would show me maybe 10 options (all of which were live and nearing the end of the program). If you want to cancel it was difficult to find where to manage the subscription and it asks you if you are sure at least 3 times. I have used almost every streaming app and continue to use most of them as they each bring something to the table. Fubo did almost nothing to distinguish itself and for that reason I couldnÃ¢â¬â¢t justify paying for it any longer.

Headings: Several things to make me hate Fubo - FOREVER
Base_Reviews: Right off the bat, the highest resolution this service offered for PC was 720p. That was enough for me to cancel, which I did immediately. Then I though maybe the resolution might be higher on my smart TV. Guess what? I never found out. Because when you cancel your subscription, Fubo locks you out immediately. So much for a free trial. You only get a free week if they get to keep your subscription intact. BOGUS MAN! Nobody does that. I mean like literally NOBODY else does that. I wanted to try this service without being stuck paying the extremely high subscription. I wanted to TRY the service. Fubo has no interest in me trying it. They want me to pay. So what if the first week is free - they want the big money. So they can suck it. And suck it hard. I will never try Fubo ever again. My 2 minute experience was woeful enough, but it was long enough to see how they run their business. Jackass mofos. 720p laughin my buttocks off.The stupid thing is, I am trying really hard to find a solution to cutting the cable company cord. Headings: Absolutely horrible interface and regular crashing
Base_Reviews: I have had this service for over 8 months.  In that time, the amount of recorded shows that had technical difficulties and crashed without recording the rest of the episode or having to start all over and find where it crashed is substantial.  And they only carry the locally covered NHL games so if you are a hockey fan, this is a terrible option.  Ultimately, this service drove me nuts and was extremely more frustration than an actual "service".  The only benefit it had over some other services (ie. Youtube TV) is that they are actual recordings that you can fast forward and skip commercials (as long as it doesn't crash the interface which happens regularly).  Otherwise, trying to figure out how to run the interface was and still is a complete nightmare.  At least on an LG smart TV.  I have to scroll up to get to a menu 6 or 7 times before it actually does it.  The UI is completely unintuitive and a nightmare to figure out.  Even when you finally figure out the completely unintuitive actions you have to take to pull up a menu while watching a show, you have to do it over and over and over before it actually does it.  The frustration level with this service is way beyond what its worth at one of the highest price points of all streaming services.  I highly recommend anyone who's considering this to just move on to the next service on your list.  This one is terrible.

Headings: FuboTv stinks, will not but again.
Base_Reviews: Streaming stutter, and it will not allow you to use your VPN service.  Hard time trying to reconnect to service after a system failure. Program options are very limited, more concentrated on sporting events than anything else.  The good is you can cancel at any time. Not for me!
Will not even use the TRIAL version because $55.00 per month is way too expensive!

Headings: Stops working once you pay for it
Base_Reviews: I got this app to cast my Oculus Quest to.  Once the payment for the app went through, the Oculus no longer recognizes Air Screen at all.  Uninstalling and reinstalling doesn't work, clearing cache doesn't work, resetting the Oculus doesn't work.  Finding any information on troubleshooting is very difficult.

Headings: Didn't work well.  Sessions drop after 5 minutes
Base_Reviews: Looking for a way to cast an Oculus session to a Samsung TV and tried this app for the Firestick.  Did not work well and canceled during the trial period.  Either the Firestick didn't have enough crank or the app doesn't work well, I can say, but it wasn't a solution for me.Kudos on offering the free trial, however.  I appreciate that.
